intro: Achillea cilicica, commonly known as Cyprus feverfew, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are pinnately divided and gray-green in color. Its yellowish-orange flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Achillea cilicica is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
